intro: Antithrixia flavicoma, commonly known as the golden thread plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has slender, creeping stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native range.
